item.title: I've stopped using continuous delivery
item.description: Every project I have configured over the last five or so years has used continuous deployment. Here is how Atlassian describes it: Continuous deployment goes one step further than continuous delivery. With this practice, every change that passes all stages of your production pipeline is released to your customers. There’s no human intervention, and only a failed test will prevent a new change to be deployed to production. Continuous deployment is an excellent way to accelerate the feedback loop with your customers and take pressure off the team as there isn’t a “release day” anymore.
